TopicTitle: Anyone NOT getting stutter with mods?

Articles.Content:
I know theres posts about the stuttering issue (ive posted one) so apologies if this kinda crosses over but ive tried many different setups with mods and ALL of them suffer from stutter every 5 seconds.  Its driving me insane. 

So rather than liquid into the wind hoping there will be a fix for this any time soon, im wondering does anyone use a decent number of mods and NOT suffer stuttering? If so, can you post your mod list?

Thanks!!!

Not getting any stutter.

Spoiler

[x] Science! (xScience 4.17)

2 hours ago, Torih said:

Not getting any stutter.

Are you sure about that or is it just that you don't notice it?  What hardware do you have and what framerate do you normally get?  Can you try loading the "Platonic stations" save linked in this post:

...and then flying the Kerbal X and simply hold down the left or right cursor key to rotate the camera.  The stutter should be quite obvious even in a stock game.

(Note: If the other vessels in the save fail to load then let me know and I'll post the stub-KER_0.6 mod that I made to be able to easily load saves containing old KER parts.  I can't post for about 6 hours though)

@PadisharOk yeah, tried that save and the kerb x. Every 10 secs it just pauses for a very brief time while rotating. FPS is avg of 60 (Max 100, min 45) when using your ship.

Just tried my save and its doing the same  Not noticed it at all while using mouse look.

Guess you don't need it now, but specs are: i7 930 (overclocked to 4.2gh), 6gig ram, R9 280, ssd. win10

FYI My specs are: 

i7 4770k

GTX 780ti (due an upgrade)

32GB RAM

SSD

Win10Home

 

I also just reinstalled windows in case there was anything conflicting.  I literally only have KSP, Football Manager 2016 and Hitman 2016 installed.  Nothing else at all.   Also my mod list is WAY shorter than @Torih's!

I also get stutter.  Only using 29 mods.  It's an intermittent problem.  Mostly happens at Mun and Minmus bases.  Fps is 35+, then drops to single digits for a few seconds.  Then back up to 35 FPS.  Repeat.

Edited May 20, 2016 by Apollo13
